nav.canonical: Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method > day calculation type

checks.description: Navigate to Leave Policies unpaid leave configuration
checks.selector_hint: breadcrumb or menu path to Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies
checks.assertion: User can navigate to Leave Policies section and access unpaid leave options

checks.description: Verify greyed-out or disabled formula field indicating payroll override
checks.selector_hint: formula field or calculation method field in unpaid leave configuration
checks.assertion: Formula field displays as greyed-out, disabled, or shows override indicator message

checks.description: Verify precedence messaging indicating payroll settings override leave policy
checks.selector_hint: help text, tooltip, or message near formula field
checks.assertion: UI displays message or indicator showing payroll daily wage calculator takes precedence

nav.canonical: Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method > day calculation type

checks.description: Navigate to unpaid leave calculation method configuration
checks.selector_hint: menu or breadcrumb path to Leave Policies > Unpaid Leave option
checks.assertion: User can access unpaid leave calculation method settings

checks.description: Verify UI indicates global configuration hierarchy overrides policy-level settings
checks.selector_hint: disabled field, greyed-out option, or hierarchy indicator in calculation method
checks.assertion: UI shows that global unpaid leave daily rate configuration takes precedence over policy settings

checks.description: Verify calculation method field state reflects override status
checks.selector_hint: calculation method dropdown or selection field
checks.assertion: Field displays current calculation method with indication of override or disabled customization

nav.canonical: Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure

checks.description: Navigate to End of Service eligibility configuration
checks.selector_hint: menu path Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility
checks.assertion: User can access End of Service eligibility configuration page

checks.description: Verify daily wage formula display in EOS configuration
checks.selector_hint: formula display or calculation method section in EOS config
checks.assertion: Daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is displayed or referenced

checks.description: Verify EOS calculation method and salary components are visible
checks.selector_hint: salary components selection and calculation method fields
checks.assertion: UI displays salary components and calculation method options for EOS

nav.canonical: Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method > day calculation type

checks.description: Navigate to leave salary calculation configuration
checks.selector_hint: breadcrumb or menu to Leave Policies > day calculation type
checks.assertion: User can navigate to day calculation type settings

checks.description: Verify override indicator for day divisor configuration
checks.selector_hint: day calculation type field or divisor selection
checks.assertion: UI indicates how day divisor (30, 31, calendar days) is configured and whether it can be overridden

checks.description: Verify leave salary calculation policy configuration is visible
checks.selector_hint: calculation method or policy configuration section
checks.assertion: UI displays current policy configuration for leave salary calculation

nav.canonical: Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method > day calculation type

checks.description: Navigate to unpaid leave deduction configuration
checks.selector_hint: menu path to Leave Policies > Unpaid Leave option
checks.assertion: User can access unpaid leave deduction settings

checks.description: Verify remarks field displays daily rate information
checks.selector_hint: remarks field or daily rate display in unpaid leave config
checks.assertion: Remarks field is present and displays daily rate calculation details

checks.description: Verify calendar days reference in remarks reflects actual month days
checks.selector_hint: remarks text or daily rate calculation display
checks.assertion: Remarks display shows appropriate number of days for the month (28/29/30/31)

nav.canonical: Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method > day calculation type

checks.description: Navigate to unpaid leave deduction settings
checks.selector_hint: menu to Leave Policies > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method
checks.assertion: User can access unpaid leave deduction configuration

checks.description: Verify daily rate field is present in deduction display
checks.selector_hint: daily rate field or remarks section in unpaid leave config
checks.assertion: Daily rate field or remarks section is visible

checks.description: Verify daily rate displays stored/initial rate rather than recalculated rate
checks.selector_hint: daily rate display or remarks text
checks.assertion: UI displays the initially calculated daily rate from leave occurrence month, not recalculated rate

checks.description: Navigate to Daily Wage Calculation settings
checks.selector_hint: menu path Settings > Payroll > Daily Wage Calculation
checks.assertion: User can access Daily Wage Calculation configuration page

checks.description: Verify calculation basis options are available
checks.selector_hint: calculation basis dropdown or selection field
checks.assertion: UI provides options for calendar days, working days, and custom days

checks.description: Verify salary components selection is available
checks.selector_hint: salary components selection field or checkbox group
checks.assertion: UI allows selection of salary components to include in daily wage calculation

checks.description: Verify system handles variable month lengths
checks.selector_hint: help text, tooltip, or configuration note about month length handling
checks.assertion: UI or help text indicates system handles different month lengths (28/29/30/31 days)

nav.canonical: End of Service Eligibility > Salary Components > Calculation Method

checks.description: Navigate to End of Service eligibility configuration
checks.selector_hint: menu path to End of Service Eligibility settings
checks.assertion: User can access End of Service Eligibility configuration

checks.description: Verify salary component options for leave encashment
checks.selector_hint: salary components selection field
checks.assertion: UI provides options for Basic Only or Basic + Allowances

checks.description: Verify calculation method options are available
checks.selector_hint: calculation method dropdown or selection
checks.assertion: UI provides options for calendar days, working days, or custom days

checks.description: Verify override indicator for eligible leave types
checks.selector_hint: help text or indicator showing which leave policies will be overwritten
checks.assertion: UI indicates which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by EOS configuration

checks.description: Navigate to Daily wage calculation settings
checks.selector_hint: menu path Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation
checks.assertion: User can access Daily wage calculation configuration

checks.description: Verify calculation basis options for proration
checks.selector_hint: calculation basis selection field
checks.assertion: UI provides options for custom days, calendar days, or working days

checks.description: Verify warning or guidance about open payroll month impact
checks.selector_hint: help text, warning message, or tooltip about payroll month state
checks.assertion: UI displays guidance about rejecting and resaving prorated transactions when payroll month is open

checks.description: Verify UI indicates impact on active unpaid amounts
checks.selector_hint: help text or state indicator about changes affecting payroll table
checks.assertion: UI indicates that changes will affect all active (unpaid) amounts in payroll table
